grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 縫腋【ホウエキ】stitched side of some traditional Japanese clothing, clothing with such a stitched side, robe with a round collar, stitched sides and a ran, worn by the emperor and high-ranking officials
天衣無縫【テンイムホウ】perfect beauty with no trace of artifice, flawless
kun reading compounds: 縫う【ぬう】to sew, to stitch, to weave one's way (e.g. through a crowd)
